page.title: 05Pebworth Morris Men.
page.content: Until l978, when a teacher, 2 carpenters, an accountant, a market - gardener, 2 school boys started dancing, there was no known tradition of Morris dancing here. The side, earing white shirts, knee length socks, black breeches and red, yellow and blue baldricks, dance to authentic tunes played by an accordianist (a plumber) and l2 yr. old drummer. With bells buckled to their legs they dance Cotswold and Border Morris to tunes such as{Shepherds Hey}and{Fanny Frail. l3 dancers now practice each Friday night at Bretforton's Fleece Inn and elect their own Squire, Foreman and Bagman. On May lst they gather on Pebworth Rise to dance at sunrise, then dance round the parish to bring fertility for the coming year.
